page.title: 13LOCAL FARMS
page.content: The local farms are highly mechanised with a large capital investment in machinery and buildings most of which is very specialised. As a result the workforce has steadily declined and today it is normal for a 180 heactare farm to have around 3 - 4 farmworkers in addition to the owner or manager. A number of farms are owned by firms and land use may be co-ordinated across the group. Today there are very few animals kept outside in the fields; on Churchend Farm cattle are kept in stalls and fed on special feedstuffs. After fattening they are sold at the market for beef. Other farms such as Wickham Hall keep cattle outside and sometimes some sheep. The latter are also kept on the School estate by the boarding department.
